intro: Peristrophe caulopsila, commonly known as the narrow-leafed peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
